posts.content:
A third class is usually useful, but I wouldn't add a third class just to add a third class. One of the best builds ever is a single class, the Melee Mage.
I can throw a Cleric 24 Rogue 6 together within an hour and edit into this post.

EDIT: ... And here it is. With your high WIS, you won't need Spell Focus, and the Spell Penetration feats make you penetrate as if you were a pure level 30 Cleric. Zen Archery was my solution for how to get a good AB.
I just noticed that if you replace those last 2 Great WIS feats with Epic Prowess and Armor Skin, you would get the same AB and +2 AC, at the cost of -1 DC for your spells and a couple fewer spells per day, and -1 on Will saves. It might be worth while.

I agree that a third class would almost always be beneficial, but still, I think the rule should not be "Always have a third class", but "Always check to see if you would benefit from a third class."

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:I believe we built one with Fighter 4 in that other thread, too. He might have wanted only those 2 classes for roleplay reasons.
I agree that a third class would almost always be beneficial, but still, I think the rule should not be "Always have a third class", but "Always check to see if you would benefit from a third class."
Well, if that were the rule, then the answer would always be yes, therefore the other rule. But, RP is a whole different thing. I am not and cannot argue in favor of RP-oriented build choices, as it's a very personal thing. I know someone, for example, who never takes KD or IKD with Paladins because he says knocking your enemies down is unlawful. However, the fact remains that KD and IKD will make a Paladin build stronger, regardless of RP.

I guess what I'm trying to say is that this is the ECB, we specialize in building powerful toons here, which sometimes, depending on some players' interpretation of RP, can be against character, but from a powergaming point of view, which is the one we emphasize here, the rule should definitely be "always add a third class if you want to build EPIC characters". Perhaps we could add a PS at the end, something along the lines of: "uness you are going for a RP concept and wish to just make the best possible build within a certain concept".

I was gonna say some other things, but I gotta go to work. This could be a nice topic for discussion in the General Discussion forum, maybe I'll start a thread there when I have time to avoid derailing this topic here from what the OP intended it to be.

Take it EZ!
